From: "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains762@...>

>This only works for arrays that must be ordered.  What about unordered
>arrays? [...]

Jason, I think you mean "not indexed". Arrays are not "ordered" (in the 
mathematical sense), they are "indexed". If you need a collection that is 
not indexed, use either java.util.Set if the elements are unique, or a class 
called Bag if the elements are not unique. A bag contains possibly many 
copies of an element, but with no index.

Either way, arrays are not the answer. :)

Your algorithm, of course, is perfectly fine. I wouldn't say "don't use it," 
but rather, "don't get to the point where you'd want to use it." At that 
point, create a class.

JBR.
